page.title: 08Ringmer Village Hall
page.content: Formally called{Parish Room, Church {Hall}and{Parish Hall} {1778}rent of Â£10 p.a. paid to Commissioners of Charitable Trust {1891}Vicar given ownership until 1956 {1932-1956}Run by user groups committee {1940}Home for evacuated schoolchildren {1956-1985}Elected management committee {1974}New Village Hall-extension opened The Hall,run by a voluntary{management {committee}consists of 2 halls, 3 committee rooms, parish council office and 2 kitchens. Booking is very heavy. The Hall facilities are used by : Infant Welfare Clinic, County Library, Free Church, St.John's Ambulance, Brownies, Ringmer Singers, Evergreen Club, Womens Inst.,Ringmer Wives, Mens Club, Badminton Club. Dramatic Society stages 2 winter productions. The halls are hired for jumble sales, political meetings, wedding celebrations, etc.
